title: slab serif close to Aachen
content:
Wondering what face it used on this model tank box, Tamiya brand. I tried Identifont but the only things close were Aachen and Chapparel. Thanks!

Eron

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120610153829im_/http:/typophile.com/files/m60a1_3544.jpg)
author: eron s

comments.content:
not a 100% perfect match, but many of the same characteristics.

FF Zine Slab Display Black Roman available [here.](http://web.archive.org/web/20120610153829/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=FF.11243.5.18&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=U.S.+MARINE&sampleSize=48)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120610153829im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ZineSlab_6115.png)

Check out Ziggurat ( I mispelling the name) from Hoefler and Frere-Jones. You might like it. Its not a perfect match though.

[http://www.typography.com/catalog/ziggurat/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20120610153829/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/ziggurat/index.html "http://www.typography.com/catalog/ziggurat/index.html")

Mikey

Thats pretty good though--better than I could find. The 6 and the A are pretty close, which is what I was most interested in. Thanks Sebastian!

Eron
